meta.title: Forensic Medicine Test (The Champion Batch Hyderabad) - 25-10-2024 - 2024-10-25

questions.text: An individual is accused of physically assaulting another person, resulting in the victim sustaining a broken mandible. The incident, witnessed by several bystanders, prompts immediate police intervention. What action are the police most likely authorized to take against the accused individual?
Subpoena is:
BNS (Bhartiya Nyaya Sanhita) is?

During a trial of a case in high court examination of a witness is being carried out by the opposing party lawyer. The lawyer is questioning the accused and is trying to prove that the evidence was biased, inaccurate, inconsistent. This procedure can be done by the lawyer during?
The following documents are exceptions to oral evidence in court except:

A 30-year-old man married for 5 years was found deceased under suspicious circumstances in a rented apartment in Mumbai. The case has drawn significant media attention, and there is pressure on authorities to conduct a thorough investigation. According to the Indian legal process, which type of inquest will be done for such cases?

A medical officer is urgently called to attend to a patient with critical injuries from a hit-and-run accident. As the patient's condition deteriorates rapidly, the medical officer realizes the importance of recording the patient's dying declaration. Which of the following is true for recording a dying declaration in India?

options.label: A
options.text: Medical officer must wait for the presence of the accused and their lawyer before recording the patient's statement.

options.label: B
options.text: Medical officer can record the patient's statement, but it is preferable for a magistrate to do so for it to be considered in court.

options.label: C
options.text: Medical officer is allowed to ask leading questions to quickly gather all necessary information from the patient.

options.label: D
options.text: If the patient unexpectedly recovers, their recorded statement will remain as the primary evidence in court proceedings.

questions.correct_answer: B. Medical officer can record the patient's statement, but it is preferable for a magistrate to do so for it to be considered in court.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Medical officer can record the patient's statement, but it is preferable for a magistrate to do so for it to be considered in court.

questions.text: A 58-year-old man with terminal cancer in the hospital makes a statement regarding his condition and the events leading up to his hospitalization. The attending physician understands that this could be a crucial piece of evidence. Why is a dying deposition considered to carry more weight than a dying declaration?

options.label: B
options.text: The victim can be cross-examined by defense lawyers

options.label: C
options.text: The statement is recorded by a magistrate

questions.text: A Medical Doctor is under investigation after several complaints from patients regarding his prescription practices, which allegedly violate the nationally recognized medical code of ethics. He is accused of overprescribing medications in exchange for incentives from a pharmaceutical company. In the context of medical regulation in India, which authority(ies) is/are primarily responsible for issuing a formal warning to Dr. Singh?
A surgeon lends his assistant to a physician; the new employer is responsible for his actions by?

A patient undergoes abdominal surgery in a hospital. Postoperatively, the patient complains of severe pain and discomfort. Subsequent imaging reveals a pair of surgical scissors left inside the abdomen. The patient files a lawsuit against the hospital for medical negligence. In the legal proceedings, which doctrine is most applicable to this case, where the facts of the incident inherently suggest negligence without the need for extensive evidence?
Which statements best exemplifies the concept of vicarious liability in cases of medical negligence?

options.label: A
options.text: Medical institutions can only be held responsible for the actions of their employed medical professionals if the institution had direct knowledge of the negligence.

options.label: B
options.text: Vicarious liability does not apply when medical professionals commit gross negligence, as such actions are considered beyond the scope of their employment.

options.label: C
options.text: Vicarious liability extends to situations where medical professionals are acting as independent contractors within a medical institution

options.label: D
options.text: Vicarious liability mandates that medical institutions are immune to legal action if the medical professional involved has a valid license to practice.

questions.correct_answer: C. Vicarious liability extends to situations where medical professionals are acting as independent contractors within a medical institution
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Vicarious liability extends to situations where medical professionals, acting as independent contractors within a medical institution

questions.text: The most reliable criteria in Gustafson’s method of identification is
questions.explanation:
Ans. D)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Transparency of root is the most reliable criteria in Gustafson’s method for determining age in forensic investigations. Gustafson’s method assesses multiple age-related changes in teeth but is most effective when root transparency is emphasized.
  • ➤ Transparency of root is the most reliable criteria in Gustafson’s method for determining age in forensic investigations.
  • ➤ Gustafson’s method assesses multiple age-related changes in teeth but is most effective when root transparency is emphasized.

questions.text: Match the following:
Which of the following method is based on age determination based on weight and height of the erupting teeth?
At 3 years, a child has:
The age of eruption of first deciduous molar teeth:
The drumstick shape in the image shown below helps to determine:
First permanent teeth to erupt in socket of temporary teeth?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Permanent central Incisor

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The permanent central incisors are the first permanent teeth to erupt in the sockets of temporary teeth, usually between 6-7 years of age.
  • ➤ The permanent central incisors are the first permanent teeth to erupt in the sockets of temporary teeth, usually between 6-7 years of age.

questions.text: A skull was recovered from a forest. According to inquest papers, woman had gone missing after a fight with her boyfriend a month back. The skull was sent to the forensic research lab. Which of the following would identify it as a female skull? Large frontal and parietal eminence Heavy cheek bones Smooth glabella Square orbits Narrow mastoid
Which of the following feature is not related to the mandible of male in comparison to females?
questions.correct_answer: A. Angle of ramus- More obtuse
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Angle of ramus- More obtuse

questions.text: A forensic anthropologist is examining a set of skeletal remains discovered at an archaeological site. The mandible is relatively well preserved. The focus is on determining the sex of the individual based on the mandible. Which of the following features will be found in male mandible as compared to female mandible?

options.label: A
options.text: Square Chin, less obtuse angle of mandible, greater body height at symphysis, greater breadth of ascending ramus

options.label: B
options.text: Round Chin, less obtuse angle of mandible, greater body height at symphysis, greater breadth of ascending ramus

options.label: C
options.text: Square Chin, more obtuse angle of mandible, greater body height at symphysis, greater breadth of ascending ramus

options.label: D
options.text: Square Chin, less obtuse angle of mandible, smaller body height at symphysis, greater breadth of ascending ramus

questions.correct_answer: A. Square Chin, less obtuse angle of mandible, greater body height at symphysis, greater breadth of ascending ramus
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Square Chin, less obtuse angle of mandible, greater body height at symphysis, greater breadth of ascending ramus

questions.text: A medical officer, presents a challenging case to her peers for discussion. Dr. Nair is particularly interested in discussing a phenomenon, where the deceased's body temperature remains abnormally high after death. She asks her colleagues to identify which condition among the listed is least likely to be associated with this unusual postmortem finding.

options.label: A
options.text: Exposure to extreme heat leading to sunstroke

options.label: B
options.text: Fatal convulsions resulting from strychnine poisoning

options.label: C
options.text: Overwhelming systemic infection known as septicemia

options.label: D
options.text: Overdose of a central nervous system depressant, such as barbiturates

questions.correct_answer: D. Overdose of a central nervous system depressant, such as barbiturates
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Overdose of a central nervous system depressant, such as barbiturates

questions.text: Floatation of a body in water is due to?
Rigor mortis be simulated by –
The medicolegal importance of the below finding noted in the eye is:

options.label: D
options.text: To determine position of the body

questions.correct_answer: A. To determine time since death
questions.explanation: Ans. A) To determine time since death.

questions.text: A 40-year-old man is brought by police for a medicolegal examination after being struck multiple times with a lathi during a strike. On examination, several injuries are noted. Which of the following injuries would not typically be caused by a lathi? Fissured fracture Abrasion collar Incised looking lacerated wound Incised wound

A 38-year-old woman was taken by her neighbour to the emergency department after an incident involving her husband. She reported that during a domestic altercation, her husband swung an axe at her left arm. Upon examination, a significant injury was observed on her upper left arm. The wound appeared deep, with jagged and irregular edges. The surrounding area showed signs of bruising. Based on the clinical scenario, what type of wound is likely to be present on the patient's upper left arm?
A man fell from 35 feet height. Eyewitnesses say that he landed on his feet. Which of the following injuries is possible

options.label: A
options.text: Ring fracture of Foramen magnum + Lumbar spine injury

options.label: B
options.text: Pond fracture skull + Cervical spine injury

options.label: C
options.text: Gutter fracture skull + Cervical spine injury

options.label: D
options.text: Depressed fracture skull + Cervical spine injury

questions.correct_answer: A. Ring fracture of Foramen magnum + Lumbar spine injury
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Ring fracture of Foramen magnum + Lumbar spine injury

questions.text: A 40-year-old man is found dead in his apartment with multiple stab wounds. Forensic analysis reveals that some wounds are superficial while others are deep and fatal. The presence of bruising around the deeper wounds indicates they were inflicted while the victim was still alive. During the medicolegal investigation, it is crucial to determine the sequence of injuries. Which of the following findings would most likely indicate the initial phase of the assault?

options.label: A
options.text: The depth and location of the fatal wounds

options.label: B
options.text: The presence of defensive wounds on the hands and arms

options.label: C
options.text: The pattern of blood splatter in the room

options.label: D
options.text: The degree of bruising around the superficial wounds

questions.correct_answer: B. The presence of defensive wounds on the hands and arms
questions.explanation: Ans. B) The presence of defensive wounds on the hands and arms

questions.text: In what sequence do muscles develop rigor mortis, progressing from early to late?

options.label: A
options.text: Orbicularis oculi, facial muscles, thorax, upper limb

options.label: B
options.text: Orbicularis oculi, neck, facial muscles, upper limb, thorax

options.label: C
options.text: Neck, muscles of eyelid, upper limb, thorax

options.label: D
options.text: Neck, muscles of eyelid, facial muscles, thorax, upper limb

questions.correct_answer: A. Orbicularis oculi, facial muscles, thorax, upper limb
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Orbicularis oculi, facial muscles, thorax, upper limb

questions.text: Defence wounds on a dead body suggest?
Small injury causing big size bruise:
The following is a victim of a firearm injury. What is the suspected distance of the shot?
If a victims’ gunshot entry and exit wound are not properly distinguishable during post-mortem due to corrective surgery, it is known as:

During a forensic examination, a pathologist investigates a deceased individual with distinct marks on the body. The victim presents with petechial hemorrhages in the eyes, cyanosis of the nails, and bruising in the shape of a hand around the neck. Which of the following is the most likely cause of death?

A dead body is brought for autopsy. On examination of neck, a ligature that was present obliquely, and above the level of the thyroid was seen. Subcutaneous tissue under the mark was white and glistening. What is the cause of death?
The below image is which kind of Asphyxia?
The phenomenon known as "Washerwoman's hand," characterized by wrinkled and pale appearance of the skin on the hands and feet, is most indicative of:
Which of the following is not true about fresh water drowning:
The Image shows
Characteristic of Joule burn include all except?

options.label: C
options.text: Pale raised skin at the margins

questions.text: A 45-year-old man who was working in the fields all day, collapsed on a hot summer afternoon. His skin was dry and hot, face was flushed , pulse was fast and thready. Which of the following symptoms are least likely to be seen in this condition?

A suspect is apprehended for engaging in intrusive behavior involving the secret observation of individuals in private settings without their consent, with the intention of obtaining sexual pleasure. What term best describes this behavior?

Police officer brings a 15-year-old male child to doctor for medical examination. Mother of the child gives the history that his uncle has been sexual assaulting him for past 2 years, which she came to know now and complained the police. Doctor examines the anus, which shows features as in the picture below. It is suggestive of?
questions.correct_answer: B. Repeated anal sex with child
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Repeated anal sex with child

questions.text: A woman gives birth to two children at same time. One foetus is 32 weeks old on delivery and the second one is 36 weeks old. How is this Possible?

In a complex legal case involving the dispute of inheritance rights, a person is accused of presenting a living child, who is not their own, as if the child were born to them, in an attempt to manipulate the legal proceedings. This act is being scrutinized by forensic experts and legal professionals to understand its implications and relevance to the case. What term best describes this act, particularly in the context of claiming inheritance rights?

A 30-year-old woman is involved in a custody dispute and undergoes a forensic evaluation to establish the paternity of her child. The forensic scientist plans to use a bodily fluid for ABO blood typing, as the child is suspected to have inherited the secretor status from the parents. Which of the following bodily fluids is least likely to be suitable for ABO blood group determination in secretors?
A man is caught peeping into the bathroom of a girl’s hostel and trying to watch the female inhabitant’s bathe. This sexual perversion is defined as:

A 30-year-old individual diagnosed with schizophrenia commits an act that would otherwise be considered a criminal offense. The act was committed during a period of acute psychotic episode. The individual's medical history indicates sporadic adherence to prescribed antipsychotic medication. The prosecution has charged the individual with the offense. Based on the provided information, which of the following statements is most accurate regarding the criminal responsibility of mentally ill?

options.label: A
options.text: The accused will be responsible since the act was committed while not adhering to prescribed medication.

options.label: B
options.text: The accused will not be responsible as the offence was committed during psychotic episode, regardless of medication adherence.

options.label: C
options.text: The accused will be responsible due to the sporadic nature of the individual's symptoms.

options.label: D
options.text: The accused will not be responsible only if the act was committed during a state of complete unconsciousness.

questions.correct_answer: B. The accused will not be responsible as the offence was committed during psychotic episode, regardless of medication adherence.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) The accused will not be responsible as the offence was committed during psychotic episode, regardless of medication adherence.

questions.text: In OPC poisoning, treatment was done with atropine and pralidoxime. Hyperthermia occurs. What could be the cause?

A 15-year-old male presents to ED in a coma with CPR in progress. A friend found him in the schoolyard. His friend confesses that the patient has been depressed over the past several days. His initial labs reveal hypocalcemia and a severe metabolic acidosis. The urine shows calcium oxalate crystals. What was the toxic ingestion?

An approximately twenty-something year old female presents to the emergency department after she collapsed outside a bar. Physical Examination: T: 97.5°F HR: 60 bpm RR: 5 breaths per minute BP: 75/57 mm Hg Pupils are miotic but equal. Pulmonary: Clear to auscultation. CV: Regular rate and rhythm. Abdomen: Normal Neurologic: GCS = 6 (E1V1M4). Best treatment?

A 30-year-old woman is brought to the hospital by emergency medical services after being found unconscious in a park. She is unresponsive to verbal stimuli and is breathing very shallowly. Friends who were with her mention that she had been using drugs at a party earlier. Her breathing rate is 6 breaths per minute, and her pupils are constricted. Her skin is pale, and she feels cool to the touch. Which of the following substances is most likely responsible for her presentation?

A 28-year-old male is brought to the emergency department with agitation, dilated pupils, and tachycardia. He appears restless and paranoid, and he is sweating profusely. His blood pressure is elevated. What is the likely cause of these symptoms?
Arsenic is not found in which organs?
An addict develops delusion, misleading hallucination of sight and hearing and the feeling of creeping things of 'grains of sand' in the skin, he is addicted to -
Activated charcoal is ineffective in poisoning of:

A Casualty medical officer is called to assess a patient who has ingested a toxic substance. During the assessment, the medical officer observes that the patient's urine has turned green. This unusual symptom raises concerns about the specific toxic substance involved. Which toxic substance is most likely responsible for the green-colored urine seen in this patient?

A 50-year-old patient presents with complaints of pain, numbness, and darkening of the lower extremities. Physical examination reveals gangrene in the feet and lower legs. The patient reports a history of residing in an area with known arsenic-contaminated drinking water. Which of the following conditions is most likely responsible for the patient's presentation?

A hiker in a forested area is bitten by a snake while exploring. Hiker begins to experience symptoms such as swelling, pain, and bruising at the bite site. The hiker remains conscious but is anxious. What is the most appropriate initial first aid response for this snake bite?

options.label: A
options.text: Applying a tourniquet above the bite site to restrict blood flow and prevent venom spread.

options.label: B
options.text: Cutting open the wound and attempting to suck out the venom.

options.label: C
options.text: Immobilizing the affected limb at or slightly below heart level and transporting the person to a medical facility.

options.label: D
options.text: Applying ice packs directly to the bite area to reduce swelling and pain.

questions.correct_answer: C. Immobilizing the affected limb at or slightly below heart level and transporting the person to a medical facility.
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Immobilizing the affected limb at or slightly below heart level and transporting the person to a medical facility.

questions.text: A 30-year-old individual presents to the emergency department with severe pain, restlessness, hypertension, tachycardia, and sweating after being stung by a scorpion. The sting site is red and swollen, with no signs of necrosis. What is the most appropriate next step in managing this patient's condition?

options.label: B
options.text: Apply a tourniquet proximal to the sting site

options.label: D
options.text: Cleanse the wound and apply ice packs

questions.text: Knock out drop is?

A middle aged man from West Bengal presents with paraesthesia of hands and feet, hyperkeratosis, lines in the nails and rain drop pigmentation in the hands. The most likely causative toxin for the above mentioned symptoms is:
Hatter shake is seen in which poisoning?

A 45-year-old male patient is brought to the emergency department of a district hospital by his coworkers after collapsing in an industrial area known for chemical manufacturing. Upon regaining consciousness, the medical officer notes that the patient exhibits no apparent physical injuries, but there is a distinct "rotten egg" odor on his breath. The patient's vital signs are stable. Considering the industrial setting and the specific odor described, what is the most likely cause of the patient's symptoms?

In a case involving suspected arsenic poisoning, a forensic toxicologist is tasked with determining the distribution of arsenic within the body of the deceased. To ascertain the cause of death and gather evidence for potential legal proceedings, it is crucial to identify which organ would likely contain the greatest concentration of arsenic following exposure. Based on the typical accumulation pattern of heavy metals like arsenic in the human body, where would the greatest concentration of arsenic likely be found?
Alkaline diuresis is done for treatment of poisoning due to:
CSF sample is preserved for which poisoning:
A woman consumes several tablets of amitriptyline. All the following can be done, except
Not an organophosphate:
Toxicity may occur after consuming leaves, flowers, or seeds from plants containing cardiac glycosides. Which of these is typically associated with cardiac glycoside poisoning?

A farmer was sleeping in the field, and he felt a sting on his leg. He saw something moving away quickly. He then got drowsy and was taken to the hospital. He developed pain around the site and continued to bleed profusely from the wound site. Likely cause?
A 40 year male has acute loss of hair, esp on at lateral part of eyebrow. His wife notice some behavioral changes. Dr notices something over nails. Likely Poisoning?
A child consumed a fruit from the garden. After some time, he developed a high fever, confusion, photophobia, and unable to urinate. Likely Poison and antidote?
